content: On Truth Social, former President Trump reveals that he has been indicted by Jack Smith's special counsel over mishandling of classified documents found at the FBI search of Mar-a-Lago.

The Supreme Court rules that the state of Alabama must redraw its congressional map because the districts violate section 2 of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 since they racially discriminate against African Americans in the state.
CNN CEO Chris Licht departs the network after a 15,000 word profile disgracing Licht was published in The Atlantic.
North Dakota governor Doug Burgum announces his candidacy for President.
Former Vice President Mike Pence announces his candidacy for President.
A shooting takes place at the Altria Theater in Richmond, Virginia after a graduation ceremony, killing two.
Former New Jersey governor Chris Christie announces his candidacy for President.
Wildfires in Quebec cause the air quality to deteriorate in the Northeast and part of the Midwest. Millions of Americans and Canadians are advised to wear N95 masks.

Apple unveils a mixed-reality headset called the Vision Pro, its first new product category since the Apple Watch in 2015. The device is noted for its expected retail price of $3,499 that is considerably higher than other VR and AR headsets on the market.
The state of Oklahoma approves the first ever religious charter school in the United States.
